title: Understanding Your Financial Situation
instructions: Learn how to assess your current financial position accurately.

sections.title: Why Assessment Matters
sections.content: Before you can improve your finances, you need to know exactly where you stand. This means calculating your net worth, understanding your cash flow, and identifying your financial goals...

sections.title: Calculate Your Net Worth
examples: Liabilities: Credit card debt ($5,000) + Student loans ($25,000) + Mortgage ($200,000) = $230,000

sections.title: Track Your Cash Flow
sections.instructions: For one month, track every dollar that comes in and goes out. Categorize expenses and identify patterns.

key_takeaways: Net worth = what you own minus what you owe
Regular net worth tracking shows financial progress
Cash flow awareness prevents lifestyle creep
Financial assessment is the foundation of planning
